plugins.name: Tailwind CSS v4 variables to Figma
plugins.description:
Tailwind CSS v4 variables to Figma


A Figma plugin that allows to input CSS variables in Tailwind v4 format and introduces the feature to import them in Figma as Local Variables or Local Styles.


Current Stage

This plugin supports formats:

  1. HEX
  2. RGBA
  3. RGB


Usage

Local Variables

If you choose to import the CSS variables as Local Variables you should fill the "Collection Name" input field in order to give a name of the collection where the variables will be stored.


If a collection with this name exists it will append or override the inported variables to the collection.


The CSS variables are entered in the big textbox "CSS Variables"


Local Styles

If you choose to import the CSS variables as Local Styles it is only required to fill the "CSS Variables" textbox


If there are styles that already exist they will be overriden.
plugins.tagline: Import your Tailwind v4 config CSS variables in Figma as variables or styles

plugins.name: DeckBot
plugins.description:
DeckBot is a simple plugin that will take a set of selected frames, and automatically set a click interaction to advance from one frame to the next in presentation mode. Instead of manually dragging links from one frame to the next one at a time, all you have to do is select the frames you want to include in your presentation, and DeckBot will do the rest!


Instructions

  • Select two or more frames on the page
  • Run DeckBot
  • Optionally adjust the order of your selected frames in the DeckBot popup
  • Click create deck
  • Launch presentation mode to see your new deck!


Additional Features

  • DeckBot is undoable
  • Any existing interactions set on elements inside your selected frames will be preserved


How to reach out and support

Having issues? DM me on Twitter @mklickman1


---


DISCLAIMER: This plugin is presented as-is, so use at your own risk!


While I do my best to test as many edge cases as possible, I am certain there are scenarios I havent accounted for yet, but I welcome your feedback and suggestions. This began as a personal project I put together in my free time, and I will support as my time allows, but I cannot guarantee I will be able to address all concerns in a timely manner, so please take that into consideration as you use the plugin and provide feedback.
plugins.tagline: Create click interactions between frames with one click

84974.name: DeckBot

plugins.name: SVG with Tokens
plugins.description:
This plugin generates the SVG code you would like to export, but also replaces the static colors values with the original token name. For example, if the SVG would contain: stop-color="#E6EFFA", this plugin will generate instead: stop-color="var(--token-name, #E6EFFA)"


Demo: https://youtu.be/7UYkt4Ym20U
plugins.tagline: Generate the SVG code of any Figma Vector Node, including the color tokens with their default value

This plugin is perfect for improving task management and optimizing visual communication in collaborative projects.

plugins.name: Find decimal point
plugins.description:
The Decimal Point Detector is a useful tool for designers working with Figma. It automates the process of locating and highlighting components on your Figma pages that have decimal points in their x, y, width, or height properties. These components are typically difficult to align perfectly on a pixel grid and might cause issues with your design layout.

Upon running the plugin, it traverses through each element on your Figma project pages. If it finds any components with decimal points, it places a customizable warning box over them with the text "DO NOT USE DECIMAL POINT". This clear visual indicator can help you quickly identify and fix any elements causing potential issues.

The warning box and text colors are customizable through a simple user interface. Users can choose their preferred color for the box and the warning text. By default, the warning box color is yellow (#FFCC00) and the warning text color is red (#FF0000). These colors can be adjusted using the color input fields in the UI, allowing for a personalized user experience.

If no components with decimal points are found in your project, the plugin will send a notification stating "Perfect components!", offering you reassurance about your design consistency.

The Decimal Point Detector plugin is an invaluable tool for maintaining precision and avoiding potential alignment issues in your Figma designs. It streamlines the design process by automating an essential aspect of design consistency, allowing you to focus on your creative process.
plugins.tagline: Find decimal point on artboard

plugins.name: ColorAura - Enhanced Shade Generator
plugins.description:
ColorAura - Enhanced Shade Generator


ColorAura turns the creation of color shades into an exact science. Using a mathematically calibrated super elliptic curve, the plugin generates professional color scales that can be customized to fit any project's needs.


Key features:

  1. Create hues based on a super elliptic curve for smooth and natural transitions
  2. Full integration with Figma Variables for a systematic approach to color
  3. Non-linear distribution for more precise gradation control
  4. Automatic text adaptation (black/white) depending on background brightness
  5. Intuitive interface with real-time visual previews


Customization for your needs:

Take full control of your color scales with adjustable super ellipse settings and distribution types. Choose between linear and step distributions, include white and black colors in your palette, or create variable-free palettes for rapid prototyping. The possibilities are endless.


Working with variables:

ColorAura seamlessly integrates with Figma Variables, automatically creating and organizing color variables into a clean, hierarchical structure. Each shade gets a meaningful name in the format "ColorName/Percent", making them intuitive to use across your design system.


Questions and Support:

For suggestions, bug reports, or general feedback, please reach out through the Figma Community or connect with me on social media (@ninsent). Your input helps make ColorAura better for everyone!
plugins.tagline: Superelliptic curve-based generator for perfect tints & shades

plugins.name: Figma Layout Fractions
plugins.description:
Figma Layout Fractions


Bring CSS-style fractional layouts into Figma now with full support for px, %, and decimal fr units.


Design responsive layout systems using familiar syntax like:


100px 50% 1fr 2fr

What it does

Apply flexible widths to any selection inside a Frame or Group

Mix px, %, and fr units in any combination

Support for decimal fractions like 0.5fr, 3.25fr, etc.

Automatically rounds widths for clean pixel-perfect layouts

Works across single or multi-row selections



Real-World Example

Container: 600px

Padding: 10px each side

Gap: 10px between items

Layout: 100px 50% 1fr 2fr


Output:


100px (fixed)

300px (50% of full width)

Remaining space split between 1fr and 2fr

53px (1/3 of leftover)

107px (2/3 of leftover)


Perfect for layout prototyping, grids, or creating design systems with math that matches the web.
plugins.tagline: Easily create responsive layouts with CSS-like fractional units in Figma.

126012.name: Figma Layout Fractions
126012.description:
Figma Layout Fractions


Bring CSS-style fractional layouts into Figma now with full support for px, %, and decimal fr units.


Design responsive layout systems using familiar syntax like:


100px 50% 1fr 2fr

What it does

Apply flexible widths to any selection inside a Frame or Group

Mix px, %, and fr units in any combination

Support for decimal fractions like 0.5fr, 3.25fr, etc.

Automatically rounds widths for clean pixel-perfect layouts

Works across single or multi-row selections



Real-World Example

Container: 600px

Padding: 10px each side

Gap: 10px between items

Layout: 100px 50% 1fr 2fr


Output:


100px (fixed)

300px (50% of full width)

Remaining space split between 1fr and 2fr

53px (1/3 of leftover)

107px (2/3 of leftover)


Perfect for layout prototyping, grids, or creating design systems with math that matches the web.
126012.release_notes:
Figma Layout Fractions v1.2  Now with Decimal fr Support!

A small but mighty update to make your fractional layouts even more precise 

 What's New
 Decimal fr Units
Use values like 1.5fr, 0.25fr, or 3.75fr to get tighter control over flexible space distribution.

 Mixed Units
Combine px, %, and fr all in the same layout string.
Example: 100px 50% 1fr 2fr  just like CSS grid.

 Pixel-Perfect Rounding
All widths are now rounded to full pixels to avoid subpixel glitches in Figma rendering.

 Smarter Percentage Handling
Percentage widths are calculated using the full container width (not leftover space), bringing results in line with how the web and tools like Framer behave.

 Real-World Example
Container: 600px
Padding: 10px each side
Gap: 10px between items
Layout: 100px 50% 1fr 2fr

 Output:

100px (fixed)
300px (50% of full width)
53px (1/3 of leftover)
107px (2/3 of leftover)
This update brings results closer to what you'd expect from modern responsive layout tools.
126012.tagline: Easily create responsive layouts with CSS-like fractional units in Figma.

plugins.name: json Export Frame JSON
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin is designed to help users export detailed JSON data of selected nodes, including auto layout information, Frame nesting relationships, text properties, and more. With this plugin, users can easily retrieve structured data from design elements, facilitating data analysis, secondary development, or documentation.


  1. Export complete JSON data of selected nodes, including properties like type, name, size, position, fills, strokes, and more.
  2. Support exporting text content, font name, font size, and other properties of text nodes.
  3. Support nested export of nodes such as Frame, Group, Component, and Instance, preserving the full hierarchical structure.
  4. Complete export of auto layout information, including layout mode, primary and secondary axis alignment, padding, and spacing.
  5. Safely serialized JSON data export ensures compatibility and completeness.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select one or more nodes from which you want to export data.
  2. Click the export button in the plugin, and the plugin will automatically extract all relevant information from the selected nodes and generate JSON data.
  3. The exported JSON data will be displayed in the plugin interface, allowing users to copy or download it for further use.


Notes

  1. This plugin currently supports exporting properties of common node types such as Frame.
  2. Ensure that the selected node types are supported by the plugin; otherwise, related data might not be exportable.
  3. If errors occur during the export process, check whether the nodes contain excessive nesting or complex properties. Simplify the structure if needed and try again.


JSON Frame


  1. JSON
  3. FrameGroupComponentInstance
  5. JSON


  2. JSON
  3. JSON


  1. Frame

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: json frame  JSON  Figma  frame

plugins.name: Componentify
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to the repeated naming work of setting variant names!


Henceforth


One click to create a components set,

Reduce the repetition of dozens of keys to two steps.


Instructions for use:

  1. Pre-fill the component variant attribute values you want to create in the plug-in
  2. Select a Frame
  3. Click Create to turn the Frame into a set of components made using the property values set in the plug-in, and then you can modify different styles for these variations.


If you have any questions or more functional suggestions and ideas, you can leave a message in the comment area.Looking forward to it.


If it helps you, feel free to buy me a coffee.

plugins.name: Thumbnail Setter
plugins.description:
Easily create thumbnails from almost any selection, without needing to manually wrap layers; in both Figma and FigJam.


Figma typically requires frames, components, component sets, or sections to create a thumbnail, but with Thumbnail Setter, you can select multiple layers or component instances, and the plugin will automatically frame them in the background before setting the thumbnail.


In FigJam, where only sections can typically be thumbnails, this plugin allows you to create thumbnails from any selection, even from instances directly within FigJam without needing to predefine them in Figma (which was the only workaround).


How to use in Figma:

  1. Select the layer(s) you want as a thumbnail.
  2. Press Cmd+K (Mac) or Ctrl+K (Windows) to open the Action menu.
  3. Switch to the Plugins & Widgets tab.
  4. Search for "Thumbnail Setter" and run it.


How to use in FigJam:

  1. Select the element(s) you want as a thumbnail.
  2. Press Shift+I to open the Insert panel.
  3. Switch to the Plugins tab.
  4. Search for "Thumbnail Setter" and run it.

From now on, you can also use Quick actions (Cmd+K or Ctrl+K).


Limitation: The plugin wont work if you select multiple layers, including a section. However, single section selections work fine.


Feel free to share your feedback and help me make Thumbnail Setter even better!
plugins.tagline: Quickly convert any selection into a thumbnail, in both Figma and FigJam.

plugins.name: Marq
plugins.description:
Introducing Marq - Your Tagging Companion for Figma


Marq is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your design workflow and boost productivity. With Marq, you can easily add tags, emojis, and colors to your Figma elements, making organization and collaboration a breeze.


Key Features:

  1. Tagging Made Simple: Marq lets you tag your Figma objects effortlessly. Whether it's marking elements with emojis, text, or both, Marq's intuitive interface makes tagging a breeze.
  2. Rich Emojis Library: Choose from a wide range of emojis to add personality and clarity to your designs.
  3. Color Your Tags: Customize your tags with vibrant colors. Highlight important elements or categorize your designs with a rainbow of options.
  4. Save Presets: Marq allows you to save your favorite tag combinations as presets. No need to recreate the same tags repeatedly; simply apply your saved presets in a click.
  5. Flexible Application: Apply tags and presets to selected objects or the page name, ensuring consistency across your Figma projects.
  6. Real-time Updates: Stay informed with real-time notifications as you tag and apply presets. Marq keeps you in the loop at every step.


Why Marq?

  1. Effortless Organization: Keep your designs tidy and well-structured with clear, visual tags.
  2. Improved Collaboration: Communicate design ideas more effectively with emojis and colors.
  3. Time-Saving Presets: Save time by reusing your favorite tag combinations.
  4. Enhanced Productivity: Streamline your workflow and focus on what matters mostdesigning.


Say goodbye to cluttered Figma files and hello to a more organized, efficient design process. Try Marq today and elevate your Figma experience!
plugins.tagline: Simplify page and frame management in figma

plugins.name: BrandCentral Inspect
plugins.description: The BrandCentral Plugin is our in-house solution designed to seamlessly bridge the gap between our design and development teams, streamlining the conversion of Figma design components into ready-to-use CSS/SCSS code. By offering a unique method that translates text styles and visual properties directly into SCSS mixins and CSS classes following the BEM methodology, our plugin aims to revolutionize how development projects integrate design. Features include automatic conversion of component names to kebab-case, smart typography style mapping, and support for component variants and states, all automated to speed up the development workflow and ensure design consistency across all project aspects. Enhance efficiency, minimize redo's, and keep our teams in sync with the BrandCentral Plugin.
plugins.tagline: From Figma to Development

84850.name: BrandCentral Inspect
84850.description: The BrandCentral Plugin is our in-house solution designed to seamlessly bridge the gap between our design and development teams, streamlining the conversion of Figma design components into ready-to-use CSS/SCSS code. By offering a unique method that translates text styles and visual properties directly into SCSS mixins and CSS classes following the BEM methodology, our plugin aims to revolutionize how development projects integrate design. Features include automatic conversion of component names to kebab-case, smart typography style mapping, and support for component variants and states, all automated to speed up the development workflow and ensure design consistency across all project aspects. Enhance efficiency, minimize redo's, and keep our teams in sync with the BrandCentral Plugin.

plugins.name: Figma to Junction
plugins.description:
Globalize Your Designs

Globalize your work through seamless organization. Transfer written content of your designs from Figma into Junction and easily access all translated versions of the text from one location. 


Visual Context

Preview your design for visual context of translations


Get Started:

1. Launch the Plug-in

Click on the plug-in and log in with the demo account. Follow the plug-in instructions to choose a project and transfer your design to Junction.


2. Preview Your Work in Junction

Log in to Junction using the demo account below. You can view your design work in the Screens section under the Figma Demo project.

plugins.name: Aspector - Image Aspect Ratio Resizer
plugins.description:
Aspector helps designers quickly resize selected elements to common or custom aspect ratios. The plugin shows the current ratio of selected elements and allows choosing from presets like 16:9, 4:3, 1:1, and more. You can also enter custom ratios and choose how dimensions are maintained (width, height, larger dimension, or smaller dimension). Perfect for preparing assets for different platforms or ensuring design consistency.


Instructions:

  1. Run the Aspector plugin
  2. Select an image, frame, or other element in Figma
  3. Choose a preset aspect ratio or enter a custom one
  4. Select how you want to maintain dimensions
  5. Click "Resize" to apply changes


What problem does this plugin solve?

Manually calculating and adjusting dimensions to achieve specific aspect ratios is time-consuming and error-prone. Aspector automates this process, saving designers time and ensuring precise results.
plugins.tagline: Quickly resize images and frames to specific aspect ratios while maintaining dimensions.

plugins.name: D2Code
plugins.description:
Features

  • default Code Generation Support react + tailwind, react native +tailwind react native +style conversion effect preview
  • component conversion SupportMark the component to convert the corresponding custom component code create libs json info.
  • code with image urlBy configuring filekey and token, it can be displayed with pictures in the design diagram.
  • easily custom DSL: such as flutter, vue, swift
  • D2C2DPrecipitate the marked figma componentSet, and libs json, which can greatly improve development efficiency


  • react + tailwindreact native +tailwindreact native +style
  • libs json info
  • imageurl:filekeytokenurl
  • fluttervueswift
  • D2C2Dfigma componentSetlibs json



How to use

  • d2code document
  • Selecting a layer will automatically convert out the code
  • mark the layer's name with "#CustomComponent" such as "#Button"
  • Copy and paste or save code file to you demo or project
  • After the test is perfect, package the custom component, write libs json, and let the designer precipitate componentset with mark


  • d2code
  • "#CustomComponent"
  • demo
  • libs jsonComponentSet



Tips:

  • Currently only autolayout is supported, non-autolayout will be supported in the future
  • Try to keep the layer structure as simple as possible to avoid overlapping layers


  • autolayout autolayout
plugins.tagline: Design to code. easily customize conversion rules. Highly reusable code.

plugins.name: Random Number
plugins.description:
Random number works by selecting one or multiple texts and changing their content to a random value.


The user can add the maximum and minimum values (range) in which the random values will be. Choose between integer or decimal values and

include prefix or suffix to the number.


Example:

max: 200, min: 0

Select Integer

prefix: "U$ "

result: U$ 100

plugins.name: Replace with Component
plugins.description:
Replace with Component Instance is a simple Figma plugin that lets you select multiple frames and replace them all at once with instances of a chosen component. This tool saves time and ensures consistency by automating the process of updating repeated elements.


How to Use:

  1. Select the Frames: Choose the frames you want to replace.
  2. Run the Plugin: Right-click, go to Plugins Replace with Component Replace with Component.
  3. Select the Component: Pick the component you want to use from the list.


Viola!
plugins.tagline: Replace your frames with components in just a few clicks!

plugins.name: Ollama Auto Fill
plugins.description:
Ollama Auto Fill


Before Use:

Please install and run Ollama according to my tutorial:


  1. Tutorial: document
  2. For more information, please visit my official website: https://figma.comfyui.asia


Description

Ollama Auto Fill is a powerful Figma plugin that leverages the Ollama local large language model to automatically generate and fill text content. Designed specifically for designers, this tool can quickly generate multiple unique text items and automatically populate them into selected Figma text components, significantly enhancing design efficiency.


Key Features

Generate high-quality text using the Ollama local large language model

Support batch generation of multiple unique text items

Automatically fill generated text into selected Figma text components

Clean and intuitive user interface for easy operation

Real-time selection updates and error prompts for a smooth user experience


How It Works

1. Install the Ollama Auto Fill plugin in Figma

2. Ensure the local Ollama service is running (default address: http://localhost:11434)

3. Select one or more text components in your Figma design

4. Run the Ollama Auto Fill plugin

5. Enter your prompt in the plugin interface

6. Click the "Generate Text" button

7. Wait for text generation to complete, and the generated text will automatically fill the selected text components


Why Use Ollama Auto Fill?

Save time: Quickly generate realistic and contextually appropriate text content

Enhance creativity: Get inspired by AI-generated text for your designs

Improve workflow: Seamlessly integrate text generation into your Figma design process

Maintain privacy: Utilize a local language model for data security


Requirements

Figma desktop app

Locally installed and running Ollama service (default address: http://localhost:11434)


Notes

Ensure the Ollama service is running locally and accessible

The plugin requires at least one text component to be selected to generate text

The number of generated text items will match the number of selected text components


Ollama Auto Fill streamlines your design process by providing instant, high-quality text content. Try it now and experience the power of local AI-assisted text generation in your Figma designs!
plugins.tagline: A Figma plugin that uses the Ollama local language model to auto-generate and fill text

114185.name: Ollama Auto Fill
114185.description:
Ollama Auto Fill


Before Use:

networkAccess.reasoning: Access to local Ollama server, online AI model providers, and required UI resources

114185.release_notes:
Ollama Auto Fill v3 Update Notes

 Major Update: Now Supporting Online AI Models!

New Features:
 Multiple AI Service Providers Support (OpenAI, Deepseek, SiliconFlow)
 New Settings Interface with Local/Online Model Switch
 Flexible Model Configuration Options
 Secure API Key Storage

Improvements:
 Enhanced User Interface Design
 Better Error Handling and Notifications
 Improved Model Name Display
 Enhanced Configuration Stability

This update makes Ollama Auto Fill more powerful and flexible. Whether you prefer using local Ollama models or online AI services, you can easily generate high-quality text content.

 Note: Using online models requires API keys from respective service providers.
114185.tagline: A Figma plugin that uses the Ollama local language model to auto-generate and fill text

plugins.name: ConvertCase
plugins.description:
Convertcase lets you instantly convert text to Sentence case, lowercase, UPPER CASE, or Title Case directly within Figma. No more copy-paste or external tools needed!


Built with surprisingly basic coding and ChatGPT, Convertcase empowers you to focus on design, not case management.


Here's how it works:

  1. Select your text layer.
  2. Choose your desired case conversion from the Convertcase plugin menu.
  3. Boom! Your text is instantly transformed.


Save time and streamline your design workflow with Convertcase. Try it today!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Convert Text Case in Figma

plugins.name: Dola Project Starter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you, in one click, set up a new project with a good practice pages structure, variables and styles!


Generated styles and variables are based on Tailwind standards which is eliminating the gap between design and development styling primitives and improving the workflow out of the box.


This starter sets up:

  • color variables (primary shades, grays, destructive, border, etc.)
  • spacings variables
  • border radius variables
  • drop shadow effects
  • text styles (like text-2xl/font-bold, etc.)
  • grid styles (base, md, lg, xl, 2xl)
  • pages structure
  • file cover page


And many might be planned, such as:

  • generated style guide based on styles
  • components (buttons, toggles, image ratios, etc)
  • tailwind config export for developers
  • and maybe something else..


So stay tuned, and leave you feedback about what should we improve or add next.


With love,

Dola Service Team
plugins.tagline: One-click project starter with Tailwind text, shadow, grid styles and pages structure

plugins.name: ASCII Art Generator
plugins.description:
Bring old-school, retro ASCII magic straight into Figma with the ASCII Art Generator plugin! Turn any imageportraits, logos, iconsinto radiant text-based artwork inspired by classic terminal visuals.


  1. Subscription via plugin or one-time payment license
  2. Get one-time-payment lifetime license here ->


Key Features

Live Image Import

Upload any image (JPG/PNG) or paste a URL and instantly see it in ASCII form.


Full Adjustment Controls

Brightness, Contrast & Blur sliders

Invert toggle for negativestyle art


Rich Dithering Options

FloydSteinberg, Atkinson, Ordered Bayer & Noise dithering

Toggle Ignore White to preserve whitespace


Multiple Character Sets

Standard (@%#*+=-:.)

Block ()

Binary (0/1), Hex (0F)

Custom Manual character

Ultra-detailed glyph palette


Edge-Detection Modes

Sobel outline for high-contrast edges

Difference-of-Gaussians DOG contour style


Flexible Output Formats (Pro)

Editable text node in Figma (pro)

PNG export

SVG code insert (pro) Vector outline (path-based)


Seamless Insertion

One-click Insert drops your ASCII art into the canvas, centered and ready to tweak.


Copy & Share

Copy pure ASCII text to clipboard or export vector/SVG code for use elsewhere.


Free Trial & License

2 free insertions under trial (PNG)

Easy upgrade flow via in-plugin Upgrade (current user) or Activate License (1 or multiple one-time-payment) buttons

Usage counter and mouse-follower overlay when trial ends

accepted.name: Eugenio Ciccale
accepted.description:
I'm a Product Designer & Front-end developer creating Figma Plugins to enhance your creative workflows

https://shop.plusuidesign.com/

plugins.tagline: Convert images into ASCII art in Figma with brightness, contrast, dithering, and vector export

plugins.name: RGAA Audit
plugins.description: Enhance your design workflow with this Accessibility Audit Plugin, built to detect and address accessibility issues based on the RGAA (Rfrentiel Gnral d'Amlioration de l'Accessibilit) standards
plugins.tagline: Built to detect and address accessibility issues based on the RGAA

122824.name: RGAA Audit
122824.description: Enhance your design workflow with this Accessibility Audit Plugin, built to detect and address accessibility issues based on the RGAA (Rfrentiel Gnral d'Amlioration de l'Accessibilit) standards
122824.release_notes: Hidden elements are no longer scanned
122824.tagline: Built to detect and address accessibility issues based on the RGAA

plugins.name: CSV to Frames
plugins.description: The CSV to Frames plugin for Figma allows you to seamlessly convert your CSV data into beautifully designed frames. Simply upload your CSV file, ensure your text layers are named according to your headers, and watch as the plugin generates frames filled with your data. Perfect for designers looking to automate the creation of multiple designs from structured data, this plugin enhances your workflow and saves you valuable time. Whether you're creating mockups, presentations, or data visualizations, CSV to Frames makes it easy to bring your ideas to life!
plugins.tagline: Transform Your CSV Data into Stunning Frames Effortlessly!

119098.name: CSV to Frames
119098.description: The CSV to Frames plugin for Figma allows you to seamlessly convert your CSV data into beautifully designed frames. 119098.tagline: Transform Your CSV Data into Stunning Frames Effortlessly!

plugins.name: AI Font Pairing
plugins.description:
Font pairing is one of the hardest feats of typography and good visual design. I still remember when I made posters (and still do) for a graphic design class, how bad pairings can easily make or break things.


So, I built a plugin where you can get an analysis and score for your font pairing with some suggestions.
plugins.tagline: An AI plugin where you can get an analysis and score for your font pairing with suggestions.

110789.name: AI Font Pairing
110789.description:

So, I built a plugin where you can get an analysis and score for your font pairing with some suggestions.
110789.release_notes: Did some new fixes to the code
110789.tagline: An AI plugin where you can get an analysis and score for your font pairing with suggestions.

plugins.name: Circle Packing
plugins.description:
Packing circles with random sizes in a given shape.


Please try the tutorial below first


Tutorial

  1. Create a Frame with a white background and set its size to 400 x 400.
  2. Draw a black circle (#000000) with a size of 300 x 300, centered within the frame.
  3. Open the plugin and make sure the Mask Color is black (#000000)
  4. Select the Frame and click "Generate."
  5. Adjust the settings and enjoy!


Input Settings

  1. Mask Color: The part inside the frame where circles can be generated inside.
  2. Filter Quality: (0 - 100%) In a large Frame, reducing filter quality will help it generate faster.


Output Settings

  1. Num of Circles: (1 - 10,000) The maximum number of circles that can be generated.
  2. Circle Color: The color of the generated circles.
  3. Min. Radius: (1 - 10,000) The smallest radius for the generated circles.
  4. Max. Radius: (1 - 10,000) The largest radius for the generated circles. If the minimum and maximum values differ, each circle's radius will be randomly chosen between these two values.
  5. Padding Radius: (0 - 10,000) The extra radius (space) between circles to prevent them from overlapping.
  6. Bias: (0 - 10,000) When set to 0, circles have an equal chance to be any size between the minimum and maximum. When set to 1 or higher, circles will tend to be either very large (first) or very small (if it cannot fit).
  7. Num of Attempts: (1 - 1000) The number of tries to add circles. For example, if the number of circles is set to 500 and attempts are set to 5, the plugin will try to generate 500 circles. If the first attempt fails, it will try up to 5 times. This means it will try up to 2,500 times or stop once 500 circles are successfully created.


Pricing

  1. 10 free uses with full access to all features.
  2. Unlock unlimited access and future updates for a one-time purchase.
plugins.tagline: Generate Random Circles inside Given Shape

  5. Adjust the settings and enjoy!


Input Settings

  1. Mask Color: The part inside the frame where circles can be generated inside.
  2. Filter Quality: (0 - 100%) In a large Frame, reducing filter quality will help it generate faster.


Output Settings

  1. Num of Circles: (1 - 10,000) The maximum number of circles that can be generated.
  2. Circle Color: The color of the generated circles.
  3. Min. Radius: (1 - 10,000) The smallest radius for the generated circles.
  4. Max. Radius: (1 - 10,000) The largest radius for the generated circles. If the minimum and maximum values differ, each circle's radius will be randomly chosen between these two values.
  5. Padding Radius: (0 - 10,000) The extra radius (space) between circles to prevent them from overlapping.
  6. Bias: (0 - 10,000) When set to 0, circles have an equal chance to be any size between the minimum and maximum. When set to 1 or higher, circles will tend to be either very large (first) or very small (if it cannot fit).
  7. Num of Attempts: (1 - 1000) The number of tries to add circles. For example, if the number of circles is set to 500 and attempts are set to 5, the plugin will try to generate 500 circles. If the first attempt fails, it will try up to 5 times. This means it will try up to 2,500 times or stop once 500 circles are successfully created.


Pricing

  1. 10 free uses with full access to all features.
  2. Unlock unlimited access and future updates for a one-time purchase.
110384.release_notes: Increased the number of free uses
110384.tagline: Generate Random Circles inside Given Shape

plugins.name: New Project Page Generator
plugins.description:
Ah, the empty canvasa realm of endless possibilities, yet occasionally a breeding ground for what's known as 'designer's block.'


No need to fret! Say goodbye to sifting through past projects for page ideas. Consider us your design assistant, streamlining your creative process effortlessly by kicking off your new design project with a set of pages.


"Cover" Page: Make a stunning first impression with real-time project status.


"ABOUT THIS PROJECT" Section: Dive into project details effortlessly.


"Purpose Of This Project": Clarify project objectives in a snap.


"Who Is This For?": Define your audience with flair.


"For Development": Access development resources in one place.


"WORK IN PROGRESS" Zone: Keep track of ongoing phases.


"In Progress" Pages: Monitor the journey of User Flow, Wireframing, and Design.


"COMPLETED" Section: Celebrate project milestones.


"Completed" Pages: Showcase the triumph of User Flow, Wireframing, and Design.


"INSPIRATIONS & SOURCES" Hub: Curate ideas and references effortlessly.


"Concepts" and "References": Organize your creative fuel.


"BUILDING BLOCKS" Zone: Unlock your stash of reusable design elements.


"My Local Components": Your personal design arsenal.


"GRAVEYARD" Section: Where design ideas rest (or return).


Enjoy.

Julian

accepted.name: Julian Oczkowski
accepted.description: Lead Product Designer, tinkering with Typescript and APIs.

plugins.tagline: Kick off a new project today.
